                      Taking Inventory: Grass                      
You're growing to read this, right?   
 背包盘点：草     读这篇文章很生草，对吧？
Remember summer? Those were the days. Sun, friends, music, and spending hours upon hours lying around on our item of the week, slowly crushing it to death with your bodyweight. RIP in peace, grass.
还记得昨天，那个夏天吗？阳光，朋友，音乐，在我们的本周物品（草）上休闲流连，沉重的身体将它们压碎，安息吧，草儿。

Grass, or “tall grass” as it was originally known, was first added to Minecraft in beta version 1.6, way back in 2011, alongside maps, trapdoors and multiplayer trips to the Nether. It took until beta 1.8 before it could be harvested (with shears), and until release version 1.1 before sheep started eating it.
草，或者说“高草”是在2011年的beta1.6版本被添加到MC中的，一起添加的还有地图，活板门和下界多人游戏（看这里看这里！），在beta1.8，草可以用剪刀收获，在正式版1.1，羊会吃草。

Finding grass is easy. It’s all over the place in most biomes. You’ll find a taller variant in plains and savannah. Savannah villagers are pretty fond of it and stockpile it in their chests. You might wonder why grass is different colours in different biomes. The reason is the immutable law of the universe that “The grass is always greener on the other side.” If it wasn’t, who knows what might happen?
草很好找，大多数群系到处都是，平原和稀树草原会有高草变种。稀树草原的村民更喜欢草，所以会把它们放在箱子里。你可能不明白为什么不同的群系，草是不同的颜色，理由就是宇宙铁律“别人家的总是更好一些“，如果不是这样，谁知道会发生什么？



What’s the point of grass? Well, in the real world it’s a vital component of the world’s ecosystems and provides about half of the energy we humans get from food. The grass family includes not just lawn grass, but also crops like wheat, rice and corn and even exotic species like bamboo. Much of the rest of our food comes from animals that eat grasses.
草（译注：准确来说是草本植物）的存在意义是什么？在现实世界中，它是生物圈的重要部分，提供了人类一半的食物能量，草本家族不仅仅有草坪上的那些，还有小麦，水稻，甚至（译注：相对于西方而言）外来的竹子，而我们的食物中，除草本植物之外的其他部分，主要是食草动物的肉。

Grass is pretty ubiquitous, too. It covers about 40% of the world’s land surface (if you don’t count Greenland and Antarctica) and is commonly found in almost all of the real world’s biomes - from swamps, to forests, to mountains, to tundra. We even build with grass, turning it into thatch and straw, and use it to make biofuels for energy.
草的分布非常广泛，覆盖了世界陆地表面的40%（不算格陵兰岛和南极洲），在现实中的各种生物群系都普遍分布——不管是沼泽，还是森林，又或是高山或冻原，我们甚至用茅草和麦秆来建房，或者把它们变成生物燃料。


                                

In Minecraft, though, grass doesn’t serve quite as varied a purpose. It looks nice, so you can use it to decorate your home. You can’t put it in pots, I’m afraid, but it does provide a lovely bit of texture in a garden - a solid backdrop for the flowers. As the saying goes: “Behind every great flower, there’s a load of grass.”
不过在MC里，草可没这么多的用处，只是看上去好看点，能用来装饰自己的家。草不能放在花盆里，不过它可以让你的花园看上去更可爱——作为花的背景存在，常言道：“红花还得绿叶配“。

You can also smash it up in the hope of finding wheat seeds, which drop occasionally when grass is broken. Or, if you want to inflict the ultimate insult on grass, you can compost it and use it to grow other plants. Taller grass works even better for composting.
So there you have it. At least three uses for one of the most common sights in Minecraft. Next week: how to cook with dirt.也可以把它打碎，偶尔会掉小麦种子，当然，对草最大的侮辱是把它们制作成堆肥，然后用来种别的植物，高草用来做堆肥效果更佳。
所以你看到了，这种MC里最常见的东西，至少有三种用途，下周我们讲讲“如何用泥土做饭”。
